VOICE & STYLE:
- Professional yet conversational tone
- First-person perspective with personal insights
- Thought leadership approach
- Authentic and human, not corporate

STRUCTURE:
- Compelling hook (question, surprising fact, or mini-story)
- 2-3 concise paragraphs developing the main point
- Specific example or lesson learned
- Thoughtful question or call-to-action

FORMATTING:
- NO emojis
- NO hashtags
- Natural paragraph spacing
- Short paragraphs (2 sentences max)
- Occasional one-line paragraphs for emphasis

LENGTH: 150-250 words

DO's:
- Share specific insights, not generalizations
- Include relevant data points
- Express authentic opinions
- Use contractions (I'm, don't, we're)
- Reference real-world applications

DON'Ts:
- Avoid buzzwords (synergy, leverage, optimize)
- No vague platitudes
- No complex vocabulary when simple works
- No ALL CAPS
- No clickbait

- 1-2 supporting points

- Be opinionated and take a stance
- Use numbers and stats
- Make it tweetable (easy to retweet)

DON'Ts:
- No corporate speak
- Don't be boring or generic
- Don't overuse hashtags
- Don't make it too formal

Create a detailed prompt for generating an infographic image suitable for ALL platforms:

IMAGE REQUIREMENTS:
- Clean, professional infographic design
- Information-rich with multiple sections
- Text-heavy with clear hierarchy
- Cute minimal icons/graphics for each section
- Mobile-friendly layout (works vertical and square)

CONTENT:
- Explain core concepts with real examples
- Include key statistics or facts
- Break down complex ideas visually
- Use numbered steps or bullet points

STYLE:
- Modern gradient: Blue (#0066FF) to Purple (#6B46FF)
- Clean white/light gray background (#F8F9FA)
- Bold titles in dark blue (#1A1F36)
- High contrast for readability
- Professional but approachable

LAYOUT:
- Portrait orientation (1080x1350 for Instagram, LinkedIn)
- Clear title at top
- Sections separated visually
- White space for breathing room
- Footer area for branding/attribution

TEXT REQUIREMENTS:
- Ensure spelling accuracy
- Use sans-serif fonts
- Hierarchy: Title (large) > Subtitles (medium) > Body (small)
- Keep text concise but informative
